message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the purpose of thermometers. Thermometers are used to measure temperature, which can help us decide how many layers of clothes to wear outside. Option (A) is incorrect because thermometers do not provide information about the need for an umbrella. Option (B) is incorrect because thermometers do not measure wind direction. Option (D) is incorrect because thermometers do not measure rainfall.

This question requires basic knowledge about the purpose and function of thermometers. Thermometers are used to measure temperature, not wind direction or precipitation. Option (A) is incorrect because temperature does not directly indicate whether or not you need an umbrella. Option (B) is incorrect because thermometers do not measure wind direction. Option (D) is incorrect because thermometers do not measure rainfall. However, the temperature measured by a thermometer can help you decide how many layers of clothes to wear outside, as colder temperatures may require more layers for warmth. Therefore, option (C) is the correct answer.

This question requires basic knowledge about the function of thermometers. Thermometers are used to measure temperature, which can help us decide how many layers of clothes to wear outside. Options (A), (B), and (D) are incorrect because they are unrelated to the function of thermometers. Thermometers cannot tell you if you need an umbrella, the direction of the wind, or how much rain has fallen.
